description: The study of global change and human environmental impacts requires students to link concepts from biology, chemistry, and physics. Students investigate these links by exploring current theories in biogeochemistry, with an emphasis on understanding the feedback between physical and ecological processes and the coupling of multiple element cycles. Laboratory activities focus on a practical exploration of the methods biogeochemists use, including experience with a variety of instruments. Prerequisite: Any level II biology, chemistry, or physics course or permission of instructor.
name: Biogeochemistry
notes: Open only to seniors and juniors.
Students in BI/ES 350 must also register for lab BI/ES 350 AL or BL.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Any level II biology, chemistry, or physics course or permission of instructor.
title: Biogeochemistry: Theory and Application
